summary: Federal loans are available for projects that align with policy goals—such as infrastructure for clean water. Before a 1990 law, agencies had to get appropriations from Congress for the full amount of any loans they made. title: Credit Reform: Transparency Needed for Evaluation of Potential Federal Involvement in Projects Seeking Loans
